english: to climb; to clamber; to pull oneself up; to seek connections

etymology.interpretation: Combines the hand component with 樊 to evoke actions done with the hands, such as grasping and pulling upward. 樊 supplies the approximate sound while 手 signals the manual, climbing-related meaning.

examples.chinese: 他沿着绳子攀上峭壁(他沿著繩子攀上峭壁)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yánzhe shéngzi pān shàng qiàobì.
examples.english: He climbed the cliff along the rope.

examples.chinese: 为了升职(為了升職)，他四处攀关系(他四處攀關係)。
examples.pinyin: Wèile shēngzhí, tā sìchù pān guānxì.
examples.english: To get promoted, he sought connections everywhere.

examples.chinese: 小树紧紧攀着篱笆生长(小樹緊緊攀著籬笆生長)。
examples.pinyin: Xiǎo shù jǐnjǐn pān zhe líba shēngzhǎng.
examples.english: The young tree clung to the fence as it grew.
